# [2.2.1](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- bug: typescript export type was wrong [#121](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [2.2.0](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- feature: added TypeScript typings [#119](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [2.1.1](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- documentation: Rename "methods" to "api", note ESM syntax [#103](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar
- documentation: Fix grammar [#107](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar
- documentation: Restructure headers for clarity + some wording tweaks [108](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar + [109](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar


# [2.1.0](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- feature: Support a custom `isMergeableObject` function [#96](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar
- documentation: note a Webpack bug that some users might need to work around [#100](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [2.0.1](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- documentation: fix the old array merge algorithm in the readme.  [#84](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [2.0.0](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- breaking: the array merge algorithm has changed from a complicated thing to `target.concat(source).map(element => cloneUnlessOtherwiseSpecified(element, optionsArgument))`
- breaking: The `clone` option now defaults to `true`
- feature: `merge.all` now accepts an array of any size, even 0 or 1 elements

See [pull request 77](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [1.5.2](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- fix: no longer attempts to merge React elements [#76](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [1.5.1](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- bower support: officially dropping bower support.  If you use bower, please depend on the [unpkg distribution](https://unpkg.com/deepmerge/dist/umd.js).  See [#63](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [1.5.0](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- bug fix: merging objects into arrays was allowed, and doesn't make any sense. [#65](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar published as a feature release instead of a patch because it is a decent behavior change.

# [1.4.4](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- bower support: updated `main` in bower.json

# [1.4.3](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- bower support: inline is-mergeable-object in a new CommonJS build, so that people using both bower and CommonJS can bundle the library [0b34e6](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [1.4.2](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- performance: bump is-mergeable-object dependency version for a slight performance improvement [5906c7](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [1.4.1](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- documentation: fix unpkg link [acc45b](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [1.4.0](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- api: instead of only exporting a UMD module, expose a UMD module with `pkg.main`, a CJS module with `pkg.browser`, and an ES module with `pkg.module` [#62](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [1.3.2](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- documentation: note the minified/gzipped file sizes [56](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar
- documentation: make data structures more readable in merge example: pull request [57](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [1.3.1](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- documentation: clarify and test some array merging documentation: pull request [51](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [1.3.0](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- feature: `merge.all`, a merge function that merges any number of objects: pull request [50](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [1.2.0](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- fix: an error that would be thrown when an array would be merged onto a truthy non-array value: pull request [46](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar
- feature: the ability to clone: Issue [28](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar pull requests [44](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar and [48](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar
- maintenance: added tests + travis to `.npmignore`: pull request [47](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [1.1.1](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- fix an issue where an error was thrown when merging an array onto a non-array: [Pull request 46](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [1.1.0](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- allow consumers to specify their own array merging algorithm: [Pull request 37](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [1.0.3](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- adding bower.json back: [Issue 38](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar
- updating keywords and Github links in package.json [bc3898e](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [1.0.2](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- Updating the readme: dropping bower, testing that the example works: [7102fc](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# [1.0.1](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

- `null`, dates, and regular expressions are now properly merged in arrays: [Issue 18](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar plus commit: [ef1c6b](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar

# 1.0.0

- Should only be a patch change, because this module is READY. [Issue 15](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar
- Regular expressions are now treated like primitive values when merging: [Issue 30](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar
- Dates are now treated like primitives when merging: [Issue 31](https://github.com/AshrafMorningstar
